Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Sep 6, 2012 11:52PM 2miraclesmom wrote: I had my first trim today. I really should have had it a few months ago. My hair started growing back around my 2nd taxol treatment in Feb. of this year. It was really weird. I lost my eyebrows and eyelashes, but my hair started growing. lol The sides and back are growing really fast, but the top is slow. Now if the top grew as fast as the rest then I would not have needed a trim. oh well. At least I have hair! lol

Posts.Content: Apr 19, 2013 11:10PM 2miraclesmom wrote: I may have to try that. I'm not sure what good it would do since I do not sleep on the top of my head, but any excuse to buy a satin pillow case is a good one to me. Lol it also does not hurt all the time. It goes in stages. I have noticed it does it more if I miss my coconut oil hair treatment. Then as soon as I do it, it stops. There is no flaking so I know it isn't dry scalp.
Posts.Title: Scalp pain. 2miraclesmom 2miraclesmom

Posts.Content: Apr 21, 2013 07:50PM 2miraclesmom wrote: Alice, I was never too keen on wearing my wig and actually didn't until I started working at my daughters preschool. They requested I wear one. I didn't mind. They put me in the two year olds room and the assistant directors son pulled my wig off when I was in the floor playing. Lol he didn't know what to think until I started laughing. Then they all did and I just through it up on the shelves. I really didn't wear it after that. I was also lucky in that my hair started growing back during Taxol. I did lose my eyelashes and eyebrows then though. It was weird. Since then, it has grown pretty fast.
